data.question: What is the primary method used to assess the porosity of MV-PCN-521 series?
Which technique was employed to confirm the homogeneous distribution of TBPA or PBCA linkers in MV-PCN-521 structures?
What was the purpose of using ICP-AES and elemental analysis in the study of metal-binded-MV-MOFs?
data.answer: To determine atoms ratio in MOF samples

data.question: How was the chemical stability of MV-MOFs assessed in the study?
data.answer: By immersion of MOFs in water under acid condition and examining the unaltered PXRD patterns

data.question: What was the role of X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) in the study of Au-MVs?
data.answer: To observe the shift in binding energy indicating better coordination of Au3+ at the metal-binding sites

data.question: What was the significance of the shift observed in the N 1s XPS peak in Au-N-MV-PCN-521-FA compared to N-MV-PCN-521?
data.answer: It indicated a change in the environment around nitrogen atoms due to the coordination of Au3+

data.question: Why was thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) performed on MV-MOFs?
data.answer: To assess the thermal stability of MV-MOFs by heating them and observing weight loss

data.question: What was the main finding from the catalytic performance tests of Au-MV-PCN-521 series in the bromination of aromatics?
data.answer: Au-MV-PCN-521 series showed varying degrees of conversion efficiency, demonstrating the impact of distance on catalytic performance

data.question: How did the researchers confirm the ratio of organic linkers in MV-MOFs?
data.answer: By 1H NMR spectroscopy of the digested MOF samples

data.question: What was the purpose of using scanning electron microscopy (SEM) in the study?
data.answer: To examine the morphology of MV-MOFs and confirm the homogeneous distribution of tritopic linkers inside the MOFs
